isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER, GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 9800 - DESCRIPTION - INDICATOR AND WARNING LIGHTS

svcproc.title: INDICATOR AND WARNING LIGHTS
svcproc.para: The various warning and indicator lights in the instrument panel are controlled by a variety of components. The general categories are:

item.para: ECM (electronic engines) controls the Warn Engine, Oil/Water, and Stop Engine lights.
ECU controls the transmission service light.

ABS/Traction Control Module controls the ABS and the traction control lights. These lights illuminate to indicate brake system status. The traction control system is turned on and off by a manual switch located on the switch panel.
Other lights such as Air Suspension Release, Trailer Rear Work Light, and Power Divider Lock are controlled by individual manual switches in the respective circuits.
The Low Air Pressure light illuminates when a pressure switch closes when the pressure in either the primary or secondary air reservoir is lower than 76 PSI (524 KPa).

Turn Signal/Flasher indicator lights are activated when the turn signal/flashers are selected. The Hi-Beam indicator light illuminates when the Hi-Beam portion of the headlight circuit is turned on. These systems are controlled by a column mounted manual switch for the turn signal/flashers, and a floor mounted manual switch for the Hi-Beam indicator.
